name: Airotel Parthenon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very good hotel. Room with all the amenities. Excellent breakfast buffet. Super professional and friendly staff. Perfect location. No negative point. Really excellent !
reviews.title: Very good hotel & perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: If you want to walk Athens, and visit it in short time, this place is for you. I found it, even if I had to use a metro, all the way form the airport, carrying luggage (due to a very short but inconvenient taxi strike). The hotel, was roomy, clean, good multilingual attention. Everything a tourist needs. But on top, you are walking distance from Parthenon, Acropolis museum, the Plaka (you have to walk trough this!), metro station, and tourist bus stop that can take you around Athens on a hop on hop off daily tariff.
reviews.title: ...more convenient? Almost impossible!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Almost all restaurants around have terraces open to a view on Parthenon at night. What else to say. I really enjoyed Athens, and this hotel made it a lot easier for me, family and friends.
reviews.title: Recommended, especially for location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent stay in this hotel. Rooms were comfortable with brilliant, functional A/C. Location was ideal for the Acropolis and Plaka. The hotel itself is a bit old but the rooms were newer. Front desk staff were very helpful. Breakfast was great with lots of choice.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011
reviews.text: The hotel itself from the outside is getting dated, but the inside is fairly new. I think everything else (i.e. comfort, service, food, etc) is average.
reviews.title: A very short stay, yet left a big impression!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: easily reached by the metro, then a 2 min walk to the hotel. friendly staff will give you a map and tell you how to reach all the sites. nice (free) breakfast from 7-10. the plaka and parthenon are also just a few minutes away. the room itself is small, just a bed, table, chair, small fridge, and bathroom but the wi fi works great and the local can't be beat. if I come back to athens, I'd definitely stay here
reviews.title: excellent location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed here for three days in September and I thought it was a decent place to stay fot the amount of time we did. We just went sightseeing for most of the day and only used the room for sleeping in and relaxing when we wanted to cool off due to the heat. But the hotel was a great location in the middle of the plaqa. The main sites were easy to get to and we could return to our room whenever we wanted to. The staff were incredibly helpful and made us feel welcome as soon as we stepped out of the taxi. The only downside I will say about the hotel is the sleeping comfort, since this is a hotel for sightseeing tourists, in my opinion I thought the beds would be comfier but I was a bit let down. Breakfast was OK and it is better than the last few hotels I have been to.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The Parthenon Hotel in Athens is GREAT! We were a party of 14 (7 couples) that arrived early for a 3 night stay. The Staff did everything to accomodate us immediately. After checking us in promptly, they gave us directions, advice, and suggestions for transportation, restaurants, sightseeing, etc. They were always friendly, no matter which of the 5-6 front desk people we spoke to. The rooms are quite large, clean, with nice showers, comfortable beds, and nice linens. The breakfast is also great! Good choices including scrambled and hard boiled eggs, many cereals, yogurts, fresh fruit, vegetables, etc., etc., etc. The location was just two short blocks from the Plaka area, and about a half kilometer from the entrance to the Acropolis; and only two short blocks from the Metro. At 89 euros per night including breakfast; this IS A BEST VALUE in all Athens!!! The Gang of 14 from Seven Lakes, North Carolina
reviews.title: Airotel Parthenon - A Best Value in Athens Greece

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed here between 12- 15 september,great hotel in great location for all the main sites.Reception staff very helpfull and spoke very good english, rooms basic but cleaned everyday,with ok breafast
reviews.title: Great Hotel Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This hotel is highly recommended as from our arival to depature the staff, particularly the receptionists, were so helpful from providing us with maps and sitting down and explaining where the sites were. All major sites were within walking distance.
reviews.title: Great location & value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at the Aerotel Parthenon Hotel for a week in September and really enjoyed it. It is a great hotel in an excellent location.
reviews.title: Great hotel and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: It is in a quiet street in Makrygianni close to all the major tourist sites in Athens, and a short and enjoyable walk from the Plaka area. It is also well located for access to the Metro with Akropoli underground station about 2 minutes away. We found it well located to be able to walk around the Acropolis through Monastiraki, Psirri, back through Plaka to Makrygianni, with many interesting things to do and stop at along the way.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel & Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception staff were fantastic, always pleasant and helpful. The rooms were clean, a good size, light and airy, and the lifts although small were separated from the rooms in a small lobby area on each floor. The “business centre” was a bit public, being a computer on a desk in the lobby, and was a bit expensive to use (i.e. not provided free). However, it was convenient and safer (more secure) than an internet café, and if you didn’t like paying the prices and weren’t concerned about security as much then you could always go around the corner to an internet café.
reviews.title: Great Location - Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: Breakfast was booked into our room price and was a well presented buffet style each morning with a good range of both continental and full hot foods. A must for a good start to each day.
reviews.title: Great location, sets up the day with a good breakfast!

likes.disliked: — Hard bed and noise from other rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While it is not 5 star, it is certainly excellent value for money. We recommend this hotel to others and will certainly be staying there again when we go back to Athens.
reviews.title: Great Location - Steps from Acropolis and Plaka

likes.disliked: — Bathroom a little small. Had old fashioned vacuum cleaner type hairdryer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Quiet, convenient, good breakfast. Rooms on the smallish side, but clean, friendly and helpful staff. Would definitely go back.
reviews.title: Perfect location; close to Acropolis and within walking distance to many things.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just off the main 'pedestrian' archaeological road in Athens, this is an ideal spot to base yourself for a city break. It is central - the Acropolis Metro station is literally 2mins walk, there are two good restaurants within yards and the hotel is situated minutes from the main archaeological sites of the Acropolis and the Temple of Olympian Zeus - and the staff could not be more friendly or helpful.
reviews.title: Central, friendly and great value.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: It may not be top of the range luxury, but the Airotel Parthenon is a down-to-earth, clean and excellent value for money. In an acronym, WYSIWYG.
reviews.title: Superb location, good value hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While the restaurant does not open for evening meals, the buffet breakfasts are of a good standard, and the bar's lengthy opening hours will cater to all tastes. The reception staff are all multilingual (while I made an effort to use my guidebook-Greek, their English put my attempts to shame!), and are happy to help out wherever they can (particularly during transport strikes!)
reviews.title: Super location, very comfortable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would thoroughly recommend this as a great hotel, an ideal, quiet base to explore the historic city.
reviews.title: Great Service, Incomparable Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: CANT BEAT THE LOCATION STAY HERE FOR AFFORDABLE HOTEL WITH FIRST CLASS LOCATION.
reviews.title: BEST LOCATION AND SUPER CLEAN AND COMFORTABLE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A short walk to every major attraction, very easy to get to from the airport via the metro which will save you about 30 euro each way. 10 euro for 2 on the metro, cab would be about 40euro each way.
reviews.title: A great choice

likes.liked: — A small hotel providing excellent staff, information and good breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was very clean, had air conditioning, tv and good size bathroom. I did not like the breakfast buffet but thats cause i am picky my girlfriend liked it just fine.
reviews.title: Nice for 1 Night

likes.liked: — The friendly staff, location, and their breakfast.
likes.disliked: — Basic room, shower head- cold, then hot, then cold

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was very helpful with making recommendations on what to do and where to eat.
reviews.title: Value for money, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008
reviews.text: I would say the hotel was great I paid 140 US a night which is a great price for that area, right at the beginning of the Plaka and the base of the Acropolis, would totally recommend this hotel for anyone going to athens and wanting to be centrally located and wanting to get to all the attractions while never getting in a cab or bus. Did everything on foot in Athens.
reviews.title: Worked for me
Couldn't beat the location
reviews.text: My sister and I stayed at this hotel for one night. It was definitely in the most perfect location, we couldn't have asked for more.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel provided excellent directions for travel on the train from the airport, and we got there very easily. It was then just a few minutes walk from there to the acropolis, the Zeus Olympic temple and the Plaka district. It was certainly in the heart of everything. So easy in fact that after dinner in the plaka, we walked toward the acropolis again so that we could see it lit up at night.
reviews.title: Parthenon Hotel, perfect location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The rooms themselves were very basic, although of course we spent very little time in there. But the breakfast buffet was far better than we expected.
reviews.title: Perfect location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006
reviews.text: For 95 euros a night, I thought this hotel was a great find!
reviews.title: Basic Hotel, Magnificent Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: In the immediate vicinity of Plaka & the Acropolis & around the corner from the new Acropolis museum, very close to Syntagma Square & Monastiraki. Lots to see & do on foot, but near to the metro station for exploring other areas or for transport to the airport or Piraeus.
reviews.title: Fantastic service coupled with the best location

likes.liked: — Service oriented staff in a quality enviornment

reviews.title: Perfect location
reviews.text: I would highly recommend this hotel if you're staying in Athens. It has an absolutely perfect location, within 2 blocks of the subway, the Parthenon, tons of restaurants, and the Plaka. If I ever went back to Athens I wouldn't even consider staying in a different hotel.

reviews.title: Perfect location
reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights in August. Booked last minute, and didn't really know what to expect. The location was perfect, central, quiet and safe. Although the hotel was a little dated it was very clean, and comfortable - really the most important things. Add breakfast, very helpful staff, and a great price, i'd definitely stay again if I return to Athens.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 3 night at the airotel, it's just 400m sud of the parthenon, in the turistic centre of athens and very close to metro station, in a very quite area where you can walk in the night without problems (not in every part of the city it's possible...). Most of the sites are in a walking distance so you can visit the sites and go in the hotel when you want to take some rest. Rooms are no so big, but you can complain about it. Rooms and bath are very clear and there is everything you need. I would raccomand this hotel not only for the services and location, but also becouse have low rates, expecially if you have internet booking.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was almost perfect! The most wonderful thing without question is the location. Walking distance to everything you could need. Plaka is minutes away. All the major downtown sites minutes away. Yet somehow the hotel sits on a quite residential street not frequented by tourists and a dead end so there is no loud traffic. The reception was helpful and friendly. The breakfast was great, and complete. We had an early flight so they arranged us an early breakfast. The only complaint was that it has a slightly un clean feeling to it. I think this is due to the seemingly very old carpet that was in the room and the dated beadspread. However the bathroom was very nice. Overall great value and superb location....i dont think there is a better location in athens for sightseeing!
reviews.title: Almost Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location - walking distance to metro station, Acropolis, and Plaka.
reviews.title: Great and quiet location for an Athens visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Parthenon Sept. 2 and Sept 8-10.
reviews.title: Solid hotel in perhaps the best location in Athens

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located in a very safe neighborhood very close (two short blocks) from a metro station and the Plaka, and only 3 from the new acropolos museum, which is fabulous. Shops and restaurants are very close by.
reviews.title: Good value, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was a taxi strike when we arrived at the airport. Had to take the Metro. Very easy, take the blue line to syntagma square change to the red line one stop to the acropolis. Then a very short 2 block walk. Takes about an hour, (about the same time as a cab) 7 euros each. A cab wil cost 35 euros for two.
reviews.title: warm welcome at the Parthenon hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is exremely helpful. Hotel is clean. Nice lobby. Excellent breakfast. If you have to catch a very early plane, tell the staff and they will have a continental breakfast waiting for you regardless of the time. (even at 4 am).
reviews.title: great for 24hrs in athens

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011
reviews.text: Rooms are small, but probably larger than the typical room size of a 3 star european hotel. They are clean and neat with a nice bathroom.
reviews.title: Perfect location, great experience!

description: Six-Story Hotel situated in central location; across from the Plaka district/Old City; ten minute walk from the Acropolis.
